articles.title: Antarctica loses Argentina-size sea ice. But why is it not returning?
articles.description: This time every year Antarctica's sea ice builds back up. But this year scientists have observed something different.
articles.content:
Antarctica is missing an Argentina-sized amount of sea ice — around 1.6 million square kilometers (0.6 million square miles—reaching unprecedented lows for this time of year, according to a recent CNN article.
Each year, as the Antarctic summer draws... [507 chars]

articles.title: Argentina won't use 'one dollar' of reserves to repay IMF, says Massa
articles.description: Argentina's Economy Minister Sergio Massa said on Monday the country will not use "a single dollar" of its own reserves to make a $2.7 billion repayment to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) due this week.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, July 31 (Reuters) - Argentina's Economy Minister Sergio Massa said on Monday the country will not use "a single dollar" of its own reserves to make a $2.7 billion repayment to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) due this week.
Massa, ... [1171 chars]

articles.title: Pan American Silver confirms sale of Mara copper project to Glencore for $475M
articles.description: Pan American Silver (PAAS) said it agreed to sell its 56.25% stake in the Mara copper project in Argentina to Glencore (GLCNF) (GLNCY) for $475M in cash.
articles.content:
Pan American Silver (NYSE:PAAS) said Monday it agreed to sell its 56.25% stake in the Mara copper project in Argentina to Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF) (OTCPK:GLNCY) for $475M in cash, and announced two additional sales of non-core assets.

articles.title: Antarctica is missing an Argentina-sized amount of sea ice – and scientists are scrambling to figure out why
articles.description: As the Northern Hemisphere swelters under a record-breaking summer heat wave, much further south, in the depths of winter, another terrifying climate record is being broken. Antarctic sea ice has fallen to unprecedented lows for this time of year.
articles.content:

articles.title: Springboks grind out 22-21 victory over excellent Argentina
articles.description: South Africa were at times unable to get out of their half against relentless Argentinian pressure
articles.content:
South Africa 22 Argentina 21
Outhalf Manie Libbok scored a breakaway try against the run of play to secure South Africa a bruising 22-21 victory over Argentina and earn a second-place finish in the Rugby Championship at Ellis Park on Saturday.

articles.title: Glencore in talks for Pan American Silver's Argentina copper mine stake - report
articles.description: Glencore (GLCNF) (GLNCY) is in advanced talks to buy out partner Pan American Silver's (PAAS) 56% stake in Argentina's Mara copper project, Bloomberg reported.
articles.content:
Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF) (OTCPK:GLNCY) is in advanced talks to buy out partner Pan American Silver's (NYSE:PAAS) 56% stake in Argentina's Mara copper project, in a deal that could be announced as soon as next week, Bloomberg reported Friday.

articles.title: Argentina should ditch the peso in favor of a 'hard dollar regime' to get inflation under control, think tank says
articles.description: Dollarization "is the equivalent of a hangman's noose: it mothballs the central bank and fully does away with the local currency."
articles.content:
Nora Mazzini
Argentina should adopt the US dollar to get inflation under control, the Cato Institute said.
It would act like a "straitjacket" on the central bank and prevent it from issuing too much credit, researchers said.
"This type of hard dollar... [2682 chars]

articles.title: Argentina reach staff deal on loan reviews to unlock $7.5 billion
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund said on Friday that it has reached a staff-level agreement with Argentina to unlock about $7.5 billion and complete the fifth and sixth reviews of the struggling country’s $44 billion loan program.
articles.content:
The International Monetary Fund said on Friday that it has reached a staff-level agreement with Argentina to unlock about $7.5 billion and complete the fifth and sixth reviews of the struggling country’s $44 billion loan program.
